address: 16 W 29th St, New York, NY 10001, United States
name: Breslin Burger

reviews.review: Softshell crab burger was no good
Maybe they were having an off-night but goddam this burger was bad  dry meat, stale bread, soggy bacon skip this $20 mistake and just go to Shake Shack.
A very relaxing atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and good food.

We were excited to finally try Breslin once it reopened and were not disappointed. Service was great and well timed. We got the deviled eggs and summer squash salad - perfect starters - and shared the dry aged ribeye burger and the banana

Breslin has always been one of our favorite local go-to spots. Their bar in the front and the restaurant in the back. We have hosted events here for friends and clients, and they are top notch. From the food to the atmosphere to the

We visited this bar and restaurant after a long walk around the city. It was a Friday night and busy but the staff were accommodating and found us space in the upstairs bar to sit down for drinks only. Melanie, the bar tender, was friendly,

5 starts for the indoor decor. It is a classic New York, with dimmed lights, extra tall ceilings and is very spacious.Food... good. Just a bit too salty... but it could be one day where salt was a star.
British food at this place - super good. Nothing to complain about. Feels similar to a cafe in Chicago I liked.
british food and the feeling at this spot is excellent. Super appetizing.

The lamb burger needs to be eaten. It has the most amazing burger bun. They should start selling them. The patty is good but lacks flavor. The funny thing and which gives the burger the taste is the goat cheese.
Fun atmosphere, decent service and the food was above average....except for the breakfast potatoes, I wasn't a fan
british food and the atmosphere at this spot is excellent. This place does it for me. I will be back with my relatives. Prices were decent. This place has many reviews for a reason.
british food and the scene here is super good. great food with quality ingredients.  i will be back with my friends. it has an awesome feel to it. they have so many reviews for a reason.
Great drinks. 5 mini falafels for 14 bucks no pita! Give me pita
Great food,great service and beautiful decor,I am definitely  coming back .
Nice place, great food and excellent customer service.  We will definitely visit this place again on our next trip to NY!

Popped in with a colleague during a work trip. Food here was really good and the wait wasn't too long which is a plus when you're between meetings! Had a lamb burger which was seasoned really well, one of the best burgers I've had.

This place is fun. Came for brunch on a Saturday with my little one in tow (keep in mind this place is 21+, except for family hours) and some family (party of 5 total). Everyone was very nice and the food was absolutely delicious - everyone
fish, chips and beer. What could be more British.
Light food, great beer! Feels like your at a bar in woodstock. Very relaxing atmosphere.
Lovely little bar, good cocktails, staff could do with training on acknowledging customers, never think it was part of a hotel

Absolutely stunning!  I made reservations for our group to celebrate my wifes birthday.  We sat at the chefs table where I selected a whole roasted suckling pig for our group.  What a delicious feast and an incredible dinning experience!  Great service, great creative drinks and wonderful ambiance.

I visited on a slow Sunday, only 3 other customers I could see, and the service was attentive and friendly. When I ordered the lamb burger I asked to substitute the fries for a salad but was told that the chefs dont do substitution because
Terrible service, completely disorganised and rude.
Lovely bartenders, upscale casual, no complaints
Beers were good. Service was meh.
The decoration of the restaurant was nice.But the food was OK the salad was great in the little cake the banana cake pie  was delicious
Fantastic, lovely find in NYC
Cool, low key hangout spot.
Good food, service was a little slow. Also they open for brunch at 10 but don't serve alcoholic beverages until 10:30ish, not sure if this was a one time thing or the norm.
Wasn't a good screening space
Good if you are British, I am not.
Mezcal drinks are good, but can feel somewhat cramped.
The best lamb burger in NYC!
Wonderful ambiance, added to a rememberable night with friends.
Truly exceptional food
Pricy but good service

A cool spot with some excellent eats. Their bar area is a nice little spot and offers some tasty cocktails; the bartenders are good for a chat too. The wait staff is professional, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The food is phenomenal and one of the best dinners in the area.

great architecture. but the food is mediocre. ordered a bloody Mary... one of the least impressive interpretations I've had.  way too much jalapeno in everything. had the Breslin BEC, it was sickening.  covered in nasty cheddar and jalapeno  totally ruined it.
Great menu!

The food was acceptable, the price is also acceptable, the staff was helpful and tried to be kind, the dishes need a big update to make more logical in the way of presenting and serving, there was no bread, there was not a salt seller in

The lamb burger was just as good as I remember. The meat was tender, juciy, and done to perfection. The bun was crispy/crunchy to give a bit of a texture, but soft on the inside to soak up all the juices flowing from the meat. The thin

If you like good old American foods that are lean and mean, then the Breslin is for you, some of New Yorks finest chefs and food that taste like your eating with the Gods! Then look no further cause the Breslin is for you! Food cooked to
The lamb burger and the fries I had were done well. In general Breslin's is a good place to eat while in the area
The Breslin was so good that I came here twice during my trip to NYC - despite the deluge of culinary variety nearby.
Great for brunch!
Decent food, youre definitely paying for the atmosphere more than anything else.

This restaurant is the one I always prefer. I visit many restaurants but to this place I keep coming back again and again. The crew is very warm and the food they cook is so good. I am always happy to have a decent dinner in this restaurant. Highly recommended.

This is a really nice and intimate place to have dinner. The service was exquisite and the food was delicious.  I had the scotch egg to start which was very tasty. It's hard to find this well prepared in NY, this place definitely hit the mark. The lamb dish for dinner was also amazing -- elegantly plated and delicious.
OK you have to try the Lamb Burger at least once in your lifetime!!
Pub with great British food
The atmosphere is great and the order takes too long

As a Londoner, I had high expectations coming here with April Bloomfield heading things up seeing as shes worked at Bibendum previously, but if she was anywhere near the pass tonight shed of been ashamed. Really bland and overly salty
Great ole fashion drinks!
Popped in here for breakfast on a Sunday morning, great food, great service, great atmosphere, just wish we had found it earlier in our stay,.
I love everything about this place. The vibe, the dark wood magically lit sleek bar & restaurant, the amazing food & 5 service.

Located inside the Ace Hotel the ambiance and food is perfect for a quick bite solo, with friends or on a date. There is a great upstairs area which feels more cozy than downstairs. The Lamb burger is definitely one of the best things to try and you won't be disappointed.
Good place for early breakfasts. Nice atmosphere, good food and coffee and quick service at affordable price.
Delicious and hearty brunch!
Always good for Breakfast
Great food, but Expensive.
The service didnt care, was forgetful and took forever. Food was under-seasoned hence tasteless.
Lamb Burger. Come here with a client once in a while, and I always look forward. Dont expect to have the kitchen do any substitutes, though... simple requests shot down.
We had the breakfast and it was ok. The atmosphere is nice and the service was friendly. The dishes were... Standard
Had breakfast here. Good food, but expensive (8$ orange juice?!?) - and the staff took their time even though the place wasn't that packed

Anniversary drink was a nice touch. Food was bistro style and tasty, atmosphere great although quite noisy to talk. Young vibe in restaurant and hotelService was a bit slow, but anniversary deserts made up for it. Young, funky vibe
Excellent
Phenomenal.   The poached eggs with lentil and chilis with feloni bread worth every morsel.   Cappuccino was nice too.  Great service.  In the Ace Hotel near Times Square.
Great lamb burger. Thanks Mike!

Went there 10:30am Friday. Asked the waiter for two screwdrivers. Waiter The bar isnt open, its 10:30am in a way like we shouldnt be drinking at 10:30am. Nice guy though, food was good, and we shouldnt have been drinking at 10:30am.
Genuinely a solid meal. The classics are still great and good to see some seasonal adjustments with corn, and the chicken set being memorable. That mushroom soup was
Wonderful service and different yummy food!
Over crowded rude staff and out of cask ale
Wonderful food. Good times.

This is a great find in New York. For the Breslin experience, try the Curry lentils with poached eggs for breakfast. If you're there in the evening, try the lamb burger and their Scottish egg. The cocktails are also excellent.
Lamb burger was juicy and delicious.
Good spot for breakfast food - their eggs are great and filling! The ambiance is a bit too dark, especially when its a nice and sunny day outside, but barring that it was a lovely meal.

Good food. Had the poached eggs and curried lentils. Good combo. Coffee was good too! Service was attentive. The only reason it's not 5 stars is that is was so dark in there. I had to double check whether I had sunglasses on or not. Overall a great place!
Good but not great.  Food was a bit bland at breakfast and we were seated right next to someone working when the place wasn't all that full.
Lovley!! Grate snaks!! And good beer!!
Breakfast is excellent, if a bit pricy. A decent (and fairly posh) full English. Sausage was a bit flat. The Harissa Kale was fantastic. Gorgeously curated interior with a pub-like feel.
Tasty sandwiches. Very costly and long wait at the table. Not much choices for vegetarians/Vegans.
A little pricey but very good
Elegant space and delicious food. Very transporting!
Loved the lamb shanks, and the ambiance is charming.
Atmospheric restaurant/bar just off 5th Ave.
Incredible food here! Everything we ordered was amazing!
Service was so bad I didn't stay to try the food.
A lively place ..
Magnificent burgers ! Great atmosphere
Had a dinner with my wife. Oyster and pork chop are awesome!
Excellent breakfast and service
Excellent 4th of July menu. Great cocktails and unbeatable service. Thrice cooked chips were great.
Lamb burger, thrice cook chips and cheese sandwich (with ham) are all excellent, but the service can be hit or miss. Prices are a bit expensive, but portions are big.
Definitely get the house made terrine Platter and their fries are outstanding.
Very limited menu. Wait service very slow and unprofessional.
Best view forr check-in
The food and hospitality
English breakfast was great!

The breakfast was great, at least in terms of food. The braised kale & lamb bacon were both really nice. The coffee was really well balanced and perfect for my taste. The waitstaff in general were friendly and attentive.  The space was a
Overpriced food, frittata bit bland, sandwich good scotch egg well seasoned, homefries good.
Caesar salad was delicious and on the large side. Scotch egg was cooked perfectly.
Unfortunately service can really disappoint here. If you're a fan of the menu, it might be worth waiting through - but not for me.
Good food but very slow service
Food was excellent. Service was excellent also.
Great lamb burgers

Chose this venue for lunch. It was a snap decision, but an excellent one. Its located inside the Ace hotel. If you enter the Aces lobby, you may be momentarily confused as they have a bar straight ahead, a seating area in the center, and
Great bar and service
Came in for drinks around midnight. Good cocktails generally but only savory food available no dessert.
Creative cuisine nicely served. At 20% cheaper it would be amazing
Excellent
Good coffee. Other members of the party said the food was great.

The Breslin was an impromptu decision that Sunday morning. My wife and I wanted to try somewhere new and we definitely found it at The Breslin! The restaurant is in the Ace Hotel, a beautiful boutique hotel located on 29th Street close to
Elegant, cozy, trendy restaurant inside in a hotel in Koreatown. We had an amazing late dinner, we got reservations, everything was great. From the wine we ordered to the spiced roasted carrot salad.
The lamb burger is to die for. Scotch eggs are fantastic, and the fish and chips for lunch  is absolutely crispy and juicy.Can't even mention the cocktails, no words to describe.I always come back!!!
Good scene, pricey.
Nice place. Great massive scotch egg!!!Liver parfait was tasty...more toast though
The cheeseburger is excellent
Hamburg is great
Very nice very nice
Incredibly old New York feel with modern gastro-pub food. Great place for drinks as well with a huge bar. Get the Scotch Egg. And the chocolate bread pudding!
The lamb burger is my favorite burger in NYC, and the triple fried fries with special dip are out of this world
The lamb was delish! Oddly had two different servers during the evening, and another server helped us in between. Service was mixed because of it. That said it was an overall good experience.
